definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
young
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather
variant of 怪[guai4]

sentences.english: It is just strang for me.
Maybe it is all due to my own ignorance.
Maybe I'm less experience and more strange.

definition: to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
ignorant and inexperienced/ill-informed and narrow-minded
country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
(derog.) villager/hick/bumpkin
sour grapes (set expr. based on Aesop)/lit. to say grapes are sour when you can't eat them
pinyin: chi1 bu4 dao4 pu2 tao5 shuo1 pu2 tao5 suan1

definition: to live in plenty without appreciating it (idiom); not to know when one is well off
pinyin: shen1 zai4 fu2 zhong1 bu4 zhi1 fu2

definition: hillbilly/yokel/redneck/bumpkin
the frog at the bottom of the well (idiom)/fig. a person of limited outlook and experience
see 嗤之以鼻[chi1 zhi1 yi3 bi2]
the one who has retreated 50 steps laughs at the one who has retreated 100 steps (idiom)/the pot calls the kettle black

definition: to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
not more than so-so (idiom); mediocre/nothing out of the ordinary
country folk/rustic/rural folk
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
sour/acid
to click one's tongue
